comments:
Build 20020409

Sorry, I don't know if this is a launcher problem or PDE problem...

Steps to reproduce:

1) Add the j9 plugin to a normal 20020409 drop.
2) Open a new workbench
3) Add a J9 VM to the list of installed VM
4) Create a Runtime Workbench launch configuration using J9.
   -> Use all external plugins (there are no workspace plugins)
5) Try to launch in debug mode.  It fails.  Stack follows:

  <status
     plugin-id="org.eclipse.debug.ui"
     severity="ERROR"
     message="Error logged from Debug UI: "
     code="120">
    <exception
       message="Exception occurred while launching."
       trace="
org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException[5013]: java.lang.AbstractMethodError: 
org/eclipse/jdt/launching/AbstractVMRunner.run
	at 
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.launcher.WorkbenchLaunchConfigurationDelegate.doLaun
ch(WorkbenchLaunchConfigurationDelegate.java:197)
	at 
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.launcher.WorkbenchLaunchConfigurationDelegate.launch
(WorkbenchLaunchConfigurationDelegate.java:70)
	at 
org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.j
ava:140)
	at 
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.launchConfigurations.LaunchConfigurationDialog$8.r
un(LaunchConfigurationDialog.java:1821)
	at 
org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.jav
a:98)
">
    </exception>
  </status>

This is not a PDE problem, because the same happens when trying to launch a 
hello world java program using J9.  Moving to platform debug.  The stack trace 
for the hello world program is below:

org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException[5013]: java.lang.AbstractMethodError: 
org/eclipse/jdt/launching/AbstractVMRunner.run
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.JavaLocalApplicationLaunchConfigurationDelega
te.launch(JavaLocalApplicationLaunchConfigurationDelegate.java:69)
	at 
org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.j
ava:140)
	at 
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.launchConfigurations.LaunchConfigurationDialog$8.r
un(LaunchConfigurationDialog.java:1821)
	at 
org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.jav
a:98)

You need to get the latest (compatible) j9 launching plug-in from the jdt-debug 
page. Please let me know if this works.

I cannot reproduce the problem using the latest J9 plugin.
I will update the webpage.

Thanks, the new J9 plugin works.  I must have missed the announcement.  Sorry 
for the bother.
